text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something Alice in Wonderland Themed,
specifically, the “Eat Me” Cookies.
In the movie Alice in Wonderland, there are a

bunch of cookies that she eats, to grow, to
get bigger.

And I’m pretty short, so, maybe I can have
a few.

So today we are going to be making the Alice
in Wonderland Cookies, from the movie!
Let’s get started!

In the movie there are a variety of cookies
that she eats.
We are gonna be making

two recipes today, one is a vanilla recipe,
and one is a chocolate, to make the
different assortment of cookies that she eats.

The things you will need, for the vanilla
recipe will be: 2 cups of all purpose

flour, 3/4 cup sugar, 3/4 cup of butter, 2
eggs, we’re just gonna be using the

yolks, 2 teaspoons of vanilla, and a 1/4 teaspoon
of fine sea salt.

And then for our chocolate cookie recipe:
1 cup of all purpose flour,

10 tablespoons of sugar, 3/4 cup of butter,
1 egg, we’ll just be using the yolk.

3 ounces of ice cold chocolate, 1/3 cup of
cocoa powder, 1/2 a teaspoon of

vanilla, 1/8th of a teaspoon of baking soda,
and 1/4 teaspoon of fine sea salt!

Now let’s put it all together and make some
cookies!

We’re gonna be making 2 different cookie
recipes today, they are both Salbè.
We are gonna be starting with Vanilla.

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
combine your salt with  your flour, and
whisk together until it’s well combined!

And now we’re gonna cream together our butter
and sugar in this bowl right over here.

Mix together until it’s light and fluffy,
I’m using a hand mixer.

And now we are gonna add our eggs and the
vanilla, but remember we’re just gonna
add the yolks.
Mix it together until it’s well combined.

Now we are gonna add our dry ingredients to
our butter mixture.

While you’re mixing, it’s gonna get really,
really dry, you’re gonna think it’s

impossibly dry, but just keep mixing, it will
come together!

Once your dough is mixed, you’re gonna take
your hands, and we’re gonna form a
big ball in the middle.

Our dough is ready and now we’re gonna wrap
it up, into
some plastic wrap.

And then we’re gonna pop it in the fridge
for about an hour to chill.

And while it’s chilling, we’re gonna make
our chocolate sablè!

The first thing that we’re gonna do to make
our Chocolate Sablè is grate our
ice cold chocolate.

We need 3 ounces, and here I’ve got a little
cheese

grater, we’re gonna be using the small grate
side.

And I just popped these out of the freezer,
they’re really cold.
And we’re just gonna grate.
Just go for it!
That’s about how much chocolate you’ll need.
I put my grated chocolate back in the freezer, needs to stay cold, I’m gonna add that last.

Now I’m gonna whisk together my dry ingredients
into this bowl right here.
Flour, cocoa powder, salt, and baking soda!

Whisk together until well combined and then
I’m gonna set it off to the side.

Now we’re gonna cream together our butter
and sugar, just like we did before,
until it’s light and fluffy.

Our mixture is ready and now we’re gonna
add our egg, remember, we’re just gonna
be adding the yolk, and Vanilla Extract.
After you’ve mixed in the egg, we’re gonna

add our dry ingredients to our butter mixture,
and our frozen chocolate.

Then we’re just gonna mix together until
our dough forms.
Once the dough is mixed up, we are going to again, form into a ball, wrap it in

plastic wrap, and put it in the fridge to
chill.

And while it’s chilling, we are gonna make
our templates.

Making the templates is super easy, in the
middle I’ve measured and drawn a big rectangle,

it’s 5 inches in height, by 15 inches in
width.

Once you have your templates are ready, we’re gonna
hand mold our dough to fit within them.
Let me show you!

We’re gonna unwrap our dough that’s been
chilling in the fridge….
Baking flair!

I'm gonna start by pressing it into a rectangle
shape.

Then keep using your hands to make it fit
as neatly inside the rectangle as you can.

We’ve got our dough the shape we want and
to make sure it’s nice and flat I’m gonna

go over it once with a rolling pin, just really
light.

Now, we’re gonna wrap him up, put him in
the fridge while we do the exact same
thing to our chocolate dough.

Our dough has chilled, and not we are going
to cut it into strips, to make the
checkered designs.

Over here, we’ve got a big ruler, and I’m
just gonna

line it up at the very end, and, using a sharp
cutting knife, I’m just gonna cut

off the excess to make a smooth, straight
line.

I've placed the ruler again, on the top, taking
your sharp cutting knife,

we are gonna make marks into the side every
1/2 inch.

We've made marks on both sides, now you’re
gonna use your ruler to line up both of your marks.

Now we’re gonna score the top using your
sharp knife.

So you’re not cutting all the way through,
you’re just drawing a line.

Then we’re gonna do this for the rest of
our marks.

Now we’re gonna cut our 6 strips, using
a our scored lines as a guide.

Then we’re gonna do this to the rest of
our vanilla dough, and our chocolate dough.
And remember, save your excess cookie dough!

We’ve got all of our strips and now we are
gonna assemble them to look like
a checkered cookie.
Over here, I’ve just got a little bit of egg white, a little baking brush.
Paint the side like this with a little bit of egg, it’s gonna act as an adhesive.

Then I’m gonna take my first vanilla strip,
press him against, and then, once again,
brush with a little bit of egg.
And attach your chocolate.
Boom, perfect!

Now we’re gonna do the next layer, we’re
just gonna brush the entire
top and we’re gonna do the inverse.
We’re gonna start with vanilla, little bit
of egg, chocolate.

Then you’re just gonna keep building until
you’re out of strips.

This is what it should look like, there’s
6 strips of each dough, and they’re
alternating to look like a checkerboard.

Placing it on a piece of parchment paper,
I’m just gonna wrap it up and pop it
in the freezer to chill.

I let my dough chill for about 20 minutes
in the freezer

and now we’re gonna cut cookies and bake
‘em.
Over here I’ve got my cookie
sheet lined with a piece of parchment paper.

Sharp cutting knife and now we’re just gonna
cut them about 1/2 an inch thick.

Look at our little checkered cookie, it’s
so cute!

Our cookies are ready to bake, you’re gonna
heat your oven to 325 degrees and
bake for about 12-15 minutes.

While the cookies are baking, I rolled out
the extra cookie dough and we’re gonna

cut out some shapes that look like the Alice
in Wonderland Cookies.

Out of our vanilla I’m doing 2 big circles,
and then 2 fluted rounds.
Peel up your excess Cookie dough.
I’m gonna make a lot of these!
Look at all this dough I have!

And then our chocolate dough, I’m gonna
be cutting 2 big circles, and 2 stars.

Peel up your excess dough, I have enough dough
to have like, 3 tea parties!

I’ve got all of the cookies cut out and
I've placed them onto a baking sheet,
lined with a piece of parchment paper.
We are gonna pop these in the oven
at 325 and bake for about 15 minuets.

Once your cookies have baked and had plenty
of time to cool, now it is time for
my favorite part, it’s time to decorate!

Over here I’ve got a bunch of royal icings
that we’re gonna use to decorate

the cookies to look like they’re from the
movie.

And the first thing that we’re gonna do
is pipe the outline around each of the
cookies. and then fill them in.

For the chocolate star we’re gonna do purple,
for the chocolate circle, peach.

For the vanilla circle, yellow, and for the
fluted round, pink!

Once they’re outlined, we’re just gonna
fill them in using the flooding technique!

Our cookies are iced, I gave them a few minutes
to set, and now we’re gonna add

the design details on the top to look like
the cookies from the movie.

These little pink ones we’re gonna ice with
red royal icing and they’re gonna
say ‘Eat Me.’

The larger vanilla cookies, we’re gonna
ice them with white stripes and purple
on top, they’re gonna say ‘Try me.’

And then our chocolate peach cookies are gonna
have white details along the outside

and teal writing on the inside that says ‘Take
one.’

And then our chocolate stars will be piped
with a brown royal icing, they’re gonna
say ‘Eat Me’ as well.
And be decorated with a little bit darker purple dots.
Ta-da!

Here are all the Alice in Wonderland Themed Cookies
that we made today!

We made so many cookies that look like the
ones from the movie, they’re so cute!

And for the first time ever on Nerdy Nummies, we
made chocolate and vanilla sablè!

Sablè is French for sandy, but it should
be: So Good!
Yum-yum-yum-yum-yum-yum….
Yum!

I’m gonna be taking lots of pictures of
these cookies and posting them on
Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and Instagram.

And if you guys make these, please take a
picture and send it to me, I love seeing
your baking creations!

I don’t know, I just get a big kick out
of it, it makes my day!

And, if you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make them happen!
Thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
Eat me, Don’t mind if I do….
Oh no, not again!
Oh geez!
That’s the ceiling!
